t: The Just Judgment of the Wicked
To the Chief Musician. Set to “Do Not Destroy.” A Michtam of David.
Do*pn you indeed speak righteousness, you silent ones? Do*ld you judge uprightly, you sons of men?
No,*ld in heart you work wickedness; You*ld weigh out the violence of your hands in the earth.
The*ln wicked are estranged from the womb; They*ld go astray as soon as they are born, speaking lies.
Their*ld poison is*i like the poison of a serpent; They*ild are*i like the deaf cobra that*i stops its ear,
Which*ld will not heed the voice of charmers, Charming*ld ever so skillfully.
Break*ln their teeth in their mouth, O God! Break*ld out the fangs of the young lions, O Lord!*s
Let*ld them flow away as waters which*i run continually; When*ild he bends his*i bow,*i Let*ld his arrows be as if cut in pieces.
Let*ild them*i be*i like a snail which melts away as it goes, Like*ild a stillborn child of a woman, that they may not see the sun.
Before*ln your pots can feel the*i burning*i thorns, He*ld shall take them away as with a whirlwind, As*ld in His living and burning wrath.
The*ld righteous shall rejoice when he sees the vengeance; He*ld shall wash his feet in the blood of the wicked,
So*ld that men will say, “Surely*ld there*i is*i a reward for the righteous; Surely*ld He is God who judges in the earth.”
